title: Natchez Trace Parkway: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 5 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Natchez Trace Parkway Junior Ranger Program: Animal Masquerade       Time: 10:00 AM to 10:45 AM Location: Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center, milepost 266, near Tupelo MS Fees: Free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 There are all types of animals, big and small that call the Natchez Trace Parkway home. Join a Park Ranger to discover how all the animals depend on each other for survival. View Details      Natchez Trace Parkway Pioneer Day      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center, Tupelo MS, milepost 266 Fees: Free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 The Tombigbee Pioneer Group will demonstrate pioneer era crafts and skills at the Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center from 10:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. View Details      Natchez Trace Parkway Dulcimer Day      Time: 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center, Tupelo MS, milepost 266  Fees: Free     Saturday, September 3, 2016 A special program of dulcimer music will be provided by the North Mississippi Dulcimer Association. View Details      Natchez Trace Parkway Junior Ranger Program: Trees Have Families, Too      Location: Parkway Visitor Center, milepost 266, north of Tupelo, MS Fees: Free     Saturday, September 3, 2016 Learn how people and animals depend on trees, identify trees by their leaf shapes and play tree-leaf bingo. View Details      Natchez Trace Parkway Read with a Ranger: Big Night for Salamanders      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:45 AM Location: Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center, Tupelo MS, milepost 266 Fees: Free     Saturday, September 10, 2016 Embark on a nail biting journey as salamanders attempt to cross a busy road in order to lay their eggs in a vernal pond.  Will Ethan and his parents be able to help the amphibians make it across to safety? View Details             For more information about upcoming events on the Natchez Trace Parkway, please check our Ranger-Led Activities and Events page.
